GOD.content: via Kierkegaard, general ethics is bloodless specter of faith; teleological suspension of ethics determined by Abraham’s silence; aesthetics cultivates secret, ethics punishes it
GOD.linkedContent: via Kierkegaard, general ethics is bloodless specter of faith; teleological suspension of ethics determined by Abraham’s silence; aesthetics cultivates secret, ethics punishes it

GOD.content: filiation of impossible filiations: Kafka & Abraham, their spectral fathers, in scene of forgiveness, literature & secrecy
GOD.linkedContent: filiation of impossible filiations: Kafka & Abraham, their spectral fathers, in scene of forgiveness, literature & secrecy

FK.content: technology & religion: “ether of religion has always been hospitable to a certain spectral virtuality”  [return of virtual from OOG]
FK.linkedContent: technology & religion: “ether of religion has always been hospitable to a certain spectral virtuality” [return of virtual from OOG]

FK.content: machine-like & faith as one and the same possibility, machine-like & sacrosanctity (heilig, holy, safe, unscathed, free, “swollen”) of the phallic effect: phallus as phainesthai, phenomenon (day of phallus) & also phantasm, fetish, specter, its double: colossal automaticity [phallic in bold 2x]
FK.linkedContent: machine-like & faith as one and the same possibility, machine-like & sacrosanctity (heilig, holy, safe, unscathed, free, “swollen”) of the phallic effect: phallus as phainesthai, phenomenon (day of phallus) & also phantasm, fetish, specter, its double: colossal automaticity [phallic in bold 2x]

FK.content: spectral fantasy of dead, principal of life and sur-vival; life must be worth more than life, only has value in labour of infinite mourning > indemnified spectrality w/out limit
FK.linkedContent: spectral fantasy of dead, principal of life and sur-vival; life must be worth more than life, only has value in labour of infinite mourning > indemnified spectrality w/out limit

FK.content: in view of invisible, spectral sur-vival, an excess beyond living, life worth more than life, space of death opens—linked to automaton (exemplarily “phallic”), to technics, machine, prosthesis
FK.linkedContent: in view of invisible, spectral sur-vival, an excess beyond living, life worth more than life, space of death opens—linked to automaton (exemplarily “phallic”), to technics, machine, prosthesis

FK.content: these dimensions of self-sacrificial supplementarity, the auto-co-immunity, com-mon auto-immunity, keep community alive, open to something other, more than itself (a spectralizing messiancity beyond all messianism)
FK.linkedContent: these dimensions of self-sacrificial supplementarity, the auto-co-immunity, com-mon auto-immunity, keep community alive, open to something other, more than itself (a spectralizing messiancity beyond all messianism)

FK.content: Kant’s dignity (Würdigkeit) of the end itself (of finite being), absolute value beyond market price > transcendence, spectrality, fetishism: religiosity of religion
FK.linkedContent: Kant’s dignity (Würdigkeit) of the end itself (of finite being), absolute value beyond market price > transcendence, spectrality, fetishism: religiosity of religion

FL.content: how is the thought of the name articulated with haunting and the logic of the specter
FL.linkedContent: how is the thought of the name articulated with haunting and the logic of the specter

FL.content: for Benjamin, text & signature are specters which exhibit & archive their implosion, in ruins, [Derrida now affirms this “stance”] such is status of deconstructive text: cannot escape law it enunciates, ruins & contaminates itself [at once founding/preserving], becomes specter of itself
FL.linkedContent: for Benjamin, text & signature are specters which exhibit & archive their implosion, in ruins, [Derrida now affirms this “stance”] such is status of deconstructive text: cannot escape law it enunciates, ruins & contaminates itself [at once founding/preserving], becomes specter of itself

MONL.content: threatening & threatened promise, monolingualism & tautology, impossibility of metalanguage, but there are effects of metalanguage: at the horizon, spectral, infinitely desirable, allows the mirage of another language to tremble
MONL.linkedContent: threatening & threatened promise, monolingualism & tautology, impossibility of metalanguage, but there are effects of metalanguage: at the horizon, spectral, infinitely desirable, allows the mirage of another language to tremble

MONL.content: let all my specters loose, a desire w/out horizon
MONL.linkedContent: let all my specters loose, a desire w/out horizon

AF.content: to know what archive means, we will only know in time to come: question of the future itself, of a response, promise, a responsibility for tomorrow (spectral messianicity at work in archive)
AF.linkedContent: to know what archive means, we will only know in time to come: question of the future itself, of a response, promise, a responsibility for tomorrow (spectral messianicity at work in archive)

AF.content: the structure of the archive is spectral [see p. 68]
AF.linkedContent: the structure of the archive is spectral [see p. 68]

AF.content: spectral motif of archive stages disseminating fission, from which the archontic principle and concept of archive suffers
AF.linkedContent: spectral motif of archive stages disseminating fission, from which the archontic principle and concept of archive suffers

AF.content: Freud both accounted for ghosts, and tried to conjure them like Marx: [re: Gradiva’s ghost] Freud speaks of “real ghost,” and of a part of truth, the truth of delusion, haunted by specter of truth, truth is spectral as part of truth irreducible by explanation
AF.linkedContent: Freud both accounted for ghosts, and tried to conjure them like Marx: [re: Gradiva’s ghost] Freud speaks of “real ghost,” and of a part of truth, the truth of delusion, haunted by specter of truth, truth is spectral as part of truth irreducible by explanation

AF.content: singularity haunted by its own iterability, immanent divisibility, from the origin
AF.linkedContent: singularity haunted by its own iterability, immanent divisibility, from the origin

AF.content: faithful memory of singularity is given over to the specter
AF.linkedContent: faithful memory of singularity is given over to the specter

SPOM.content: [see GHOST]
SPOM.linkedContent: [see GHOST]

SPOM.content: specter as a foreign guest
SPOM.linkedContent: specter as a foreign guest

SPOM.content: as soon as one no longer distinguishes spirit from specter, the former assumes a body, incarnates itself, as spirit, in specter > specter an instant of flesh and phenomenality, apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: as soon as one no longer distinguishes spirit from specter, the former assumes a body, incarnates itself, as spirit, in specter > specter an instant of flesh and phenomenality, apparition

SPOM.content: flesh disappears in the apparition, dans la venue même du revenant ou le retour du spectre
SPOM.linkedContent: flesh disappears in the apparition, dans la venue même du revenant ou le retour du spectre

SPOM.content: when spirit becomes specter, an instant of flesh and phenomenality, an apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: when spirit becomes specter, an instant of flesh and phenomenality, an apparition

SPOM.content: asymmetry, we see the ghost of king resembles the king, but can’t see what looks at us, this visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh [see p. 156 are specter/ghost different?]
SPOM.linkedContent: asymmetry, we see the ghost of king resembles the king, but can’t see what looks at us, this visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh [see p. 156 are specter/ghost different?]

SPOM.content: specter takes on the form of someone other (quelqu’un d’autre), that is, a self, subject, person, consciousness, spirit; thus specter is not icon, not ideal, not image of image (Plato’s phantasma), nor simple simulacrum (thought it is so close to this)
SPOM.linkedContent: specter takes on the form of someone other (quelqu’un d’autre), that is, a self, subject, person, consciousness, spirit; thus specter is not icon, not ideal, not image of image (Plato’s phantasma), nor simple simulacrum (thought it is so close to this)

SPOM.content: feel ourselves being looked at by specter acc. absolute anteriority, outside of synchrony
SPOM.linkedContent: feel ourselves being looked at by specter acc. absolute anteriority, outside of synchrony

SPOM.content: spectrality interrupts all specularity, de-synchronizes, calls us to anachrony
SPOM.linkedContent: spectrality interrupts all specularity, de-synchronizes, calls us to anachrony

SPOM.content: specter in armor, a technical prosthesis, a “blazon of his nobility”
SPOM.linkedContent: specter in armor, a technical prosthesis, a “blazon of his nobility”

SPOM.content: question of the event as question of the ghost: first time (but also last time) & repetition, tout autre > hauntology, logic of haunting: more powerful than ontology, harbors eschatology/teleology as effects, mise en scène pour une fin de l’histoire
SPOM.linkedContent: question of the event as question of the ghost: first time (but also last time) & repetition, tout autre > hauntology, logic of haunting: more powerful than ontology, harbors eschatology/teleology as effects, mise en scène pour une fin de l’histoire

SPOM.content: what is a ghost? what is effectivity/presence of a specter? > virtuality, ineffectivity, simulacrum? is there a there btwn thing itself & its simulacrum?
SPOM.linkedContent: what is a ghost? what is effectivity/presence of a specter? > virtuality, ineffectivity, simulacrum? is there a there btwn thing itself & its simulacrum?

SPOM.content: après la fin de l’histoire, l’esprit vient en revenant, il figure à la fois un mort qui revient et un fantôme dont le retour attendu se répète, encore et encore ——follow a ghost, be followed by it, persecuted by very chase we are leading?
SPOM.linkedContent: après la fin de l’histoire, l’esprit vient en revenant, il figure à la fois un mort qui revient et un fantôme dont le retour attendu se répète, encore et encore ——follow a ghost, be followed by it, persecuted by very chase we are leading?

SPOM.content: question of repetition, specter is always a revenant, can’t control its comings and goings > commence par revenir
SPOM.linkedContent: question of repetition, specter is always a revenant, can’t control its comings and goings > commence par revenir

SPOM.content: Marcellus anticipated la venue d’un autre scholar, had to wait several centuries [for Derrida], one who can think possibility of specter, specter as possibility, who can address spirits, who knows that such is the condition of address, mad enough to unlock such a possibility
SPOM.linkedContent: Marcellus anticipated la venue d’un autre scholar, had to wait several centuries [for Derrida], one who can think possibility of specter, specter as possibility, who can address spirits, who knows that such is the condition of address, mad enough to unlock such a possibility

SPOM.content: “one never inherits without coming to terms with [s’expliquer avec (battling with)] some specter, and therefore with more than one specter, with the fault and the injunction of plus d’un”
SPOM.linkedContent: “one never inherits without coming to terms with [s’expliquer avec (battling with)] some specter, and therefore with more than one specter, with the fault and the injunction of plus d’un”

SPOM.content: [time scrambling] threat of specter, no reassuring order of presents, no linear succession of “real time” & “deferred time”
SPOM.linkedContent: [time scrambling] threat of specter, no reassuring order of presents, no linear succession of “real time” & “deferred time”

SPOM.content: betrayal, perjury, abjuration, lie, simulacrum: never very far from the specter
SPOM.linkedContent: betrayal, perjury, abjuration, lie, simulacrum: never very far from the specter

SPOM.content: via Marx, Schein-gold, money (Geld) as origin of spirit (Geist) and avarice (Geiz), transfiguring idealization of commodities: spectropoetic
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, Schein-gold, money (Geld) as origin of spirit (Geist) and avarice (Geiz), transfiguring idealization of commodities: spectropoetic

SPOM.content: exchange-value a properly spectral apparition if this figure did not prevent the proper
SPOM.linkedContent: exchange-value a properly spectral apparition if this figure did not prevent the proper

SPOM.content: speculation (the hoarder) is always fascinated, bewitched by the specter, devoted in his alchemy to haunting or return of revenants
SPOM.linkedContent: speculation (the hoarder) is always fascinated, bewitched by the specter, devoted in his alchemy to haunting or return of revenants

SPOM.content: frontier btwn public & private constantly being displaced because the spacing of the public (techno-tele-discursivity, -iconcity) is neither living nor dead: it spectralizes > less and less assured identity of political
SPOM.linkedContent: frontier btwn public & private constantly being displaced because the spacing of the public (techno-tele-discursivity, -iconcity) is neither living nor dead: it spectralizes > less and less assured identity of political

SPOM.content: “we” will not please Marxists, insisting on the spirt of Marxism as spirits in the plural and in the sense of specter, allowing untimely specters to come back
SPOM.linkedContent: “we” will not please Marxists, insisting on the spirt of Marxism as spirits in the plural and in the sense of specter, allowing untimely specters to come back

SPOM.content: there is no Dasein of the specter
SPOM.linkedContent: there is no Dasein of the specter

SPOM.content: specter, frequency of the visibility of the invisible, visibility is not seen > epekeina tes ousias
SPOM.linkedContent: specter, frequency of the visibility of the invisible, visibility is not seen > epekeina tes ousias

SPOM.content: [re: Eighteenth Brumaire: “conjure up spirits of past”] convoking (beschwören) spirits as specters, le geste d’une conjuration positive, celle qui jure pour appeler et non pour refouler ——welcoming, hospitable conjuration still full of anxiety: la conjuration…appelle la mort pour inventer le vif et faire vivre le nouveau, make come what’s not there, revolutionary
SPOM.linkedContent: [re: Eighteenth Brumaire: “conjure up spirits of past”] convoking (beschwören) spirits as specters, le geste d’une conjuration positive, celle qui jure pour appeler et non pour refouler ——welcoming, hospitable conjuration still full of anxiety: la conjuration…appelle la mort pour inventer le vif et faire vivre le nouveau, make come what’s not there, revolutionary

SPOM.content: specter weighs (pèse), thinks (pense), nothing more juste than this phantasmagoria, répondre du mort, répondre au mort > obssessive haunting, the more life, the graver the specter
SPOM.linkedContent: specter weighs (pèse), thinks (pense), nothing more juste than this phantasmagoria, répondre du mort, répondre au mort > obssessive haunting, the more life, the graver the specter

SPOM.content: the great specter of classical tradition (Rome) is convoked (positive conjuration) to allow one to rise to height of historic tragedy
SPOM.linkedContent: the great specter of classical tradition (Rome) is convoked (positive conjuration) to allow one to rise to height of historic tragedy

SPOM.content: [Marx on “red specter”]
SPOM.linkedContent: [Marx on “red specter”]

SPOM.content: via Marx, players in history as inverted Schleimihls, shadows w/out body, the specter, the red specter is disincarnated > this impossibility [disincarnation of specter] isn’t it possibility itself: virtuality? mustn’t one reckon w/ this to understand history, the event-ness of the event?
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, players in history as inverted Schleimihls, shadows w/out body, the specter, the red specter is disincarnated > this impossibility [disincarnation of specter] isn’t it possibility itself: virtuality? mustn’t one reckon w/ this to understand history, the event-ness of the event?

SPOM.content: impossibility to discern specter from specter of specter > not night where all cows are black, but grey on grey because red on red
SPOM.linkedContent: impossibility to discern specter from specter of specter > not night where all cows are black, but grey on grey because red on red

SPOM.content: specter is of the spirit, il en participe, il en relève alors même qu’il le suit comme son double fantomal > the difference btwn the 2 tends to disappear in the ghost effect, a shadowy articulation plays btwn spirit and specter, entre l’esprit d’une part, le fantôme ou le revenant d’autre part [see p. 6 are specter/ghost different?], Marx plays w/ double meaning of Geist
SPOM.linkedContent: specter is of the spirit, il en participe, il en relève alors même qu’il le suit comme son double fantomal > the difference btwn the 2 tends to disappear in the ghost effect, a shadowy articulation plays btwn spirit and specter, entre l’esprit d’une part, le fantôme ou le revenant d’autre part [see p. 6 are specter/ghost different?], Marx plays w/ double meaning of Geist

SPOM.content: spectral effect, for Marx, a dialectical position (Setzung) of the ghostly body as body proper > where Stirner sees 1st moment as spectral and 2nd as successful, interiorization, subjectivation (plus de vie) Marx sees a hyperbolic surplus of spectrality (plus de mort)
SPOM.linkedContent: spectral effect, for Marx, a dialectical position (Setzung) of the ghostly body as body proper > where Stirner sees 1st moment as spectral and 2nd as successful, interiorization, subjectivation (plus de vie) Marx sees a hyperbolic surplus of spectrality (plus de mort)

SPOM.content: when Marx says all phenomenology is a phenomenology of spirit, Derrida translates: a phenomenology of specter
SPOM.linkedContent: when Marx says all phenomenology is a phenomenology of spirit, Derrida translates: a phenomenology of specter

SPOM.content: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]
SPOM.linkedContent: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]

SPOM.content: if every specter is distinguished from spirit by a quasi-incarnation, an incorporation, then Christ is most spectral of specters > greatest and most “incomprehensible of ghosts (unbegreiflichste Gespenst)”: no concept of incarnation w/out Jesus [Gespenst: Man-God (der Gottmensch)]
SPOM.linkedContent: if every specter is distinguished from spirit by a quasi-incarnation, an incorporation, then Christ is most spectral of specters > greatest and most “incomprehensible of ghosts (unbegreiflichste Gespenst)”: no concept of incarnation w/out Jesus [Gespenst: Man-God (der Gottmensch)]

SPOM.content: Christic moment, eucharistic instance, hyperbole of acharnement itself?
SPOM.linkedContent: Christic moment, eucharistic instance, hyperbole of acharnement itself?

SPOM.content: Marx & Saint Max, heirs to Platonic tradition, associate image w/ specter, idol w/ phantasm, phantasma, eidola (Phaedo, Timaeus): living-dead, figures of dead souls > survival and return of living-dead as essence of the idol
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx & Saint Max, heirs to Platonic tradition, associate image w/ specter, idol w/ phantasm, phantasma, eidola (Phaedo, Timaeus): living-dead, figures of dead souls > survival and return of living-dead as essence of the idol

SPOM.content: character of the specter cannot be derived from a psychoanalysis of the imaginary
SPOM.linkedContent: character of the specter cannot be derived from a psychoanalysis of the imaginary

SPOM.content: specter is social, otherwise no desire, no love, no peace, no socius, no war
SPOM.linkedContent: specter is social, otherwise no desire, no love, no peace, no socius, no war

SPOM.content: secret of commodity form is substitution (quid pro quo), but one w/ ruse, perverse intervention of souffleur, parole soufflée > abnormal play of mirrors [men no longer recognize in the substitution made by commodity the social character of their own labor], commodity turns men into specters, vampires > can’t see their reflection, “but who is not so deprived?” Derrida adds
SPOM.linkedContent: secret of commodity form is substitution (quid pro quo), but one w/ ruse, perverse intervention of souffleur, parole soufflée > abnormal play of mirrors [men no longer recognize in the substitution made by commodity the social character of their own labor], commodity turns men into specters, vampires > can’t see their reflection, “but who is not so deprived?” Derrida adds

SPOM.content: is the ghost just the effect of the market economy? as Marx says, a finite delirium, a madness that will come to an end? same for spectrality in general?
SPOM.linkedContent: is the ghost just the effect of the market economy? as Marx says, a finite delirium, a madness that will come to an end? same for spectrality in general?

A.content: for Derrida, in contrast to Heidegger [Freud & Levinas too?], mourning, revenance, spectrality, living-on, surviving: non-derivable categories or non-reducible derivations
A.linkedContent: for Derrida, in contrast to Heidegger [Freud & Levinas too?], mourning, revenance, spectrality, living-on, surviving: non-derivable categories or non-reducible derivations

S.content: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same

S.content: beautiful description of the guard-like theatrical nature of quotation marks, and when they are relieved from “Geist” has spirit itself or spirit’s ghost (spectre) come on stage?
S.linkedContent: beautiful description of the guard-like theatrical nature of quotation marks, and when they are relieved from “Geist” has spirit itself or spirit’s ghost (spectre) come on stage?

S.content: for Heidegger, that which causes destitution of spirit is of spirit, is its double, its spectral duplicity; yet, this is not Descartes’ Evil Genius (böse Geist), the destitution, the demonic, comes from cogito’s substantializaton, accepts lies, destruction, doesn’t question (Schellingian)
S.linkedContent: for Heidegger, that which causes destitution of spirit is of spirit, is its double, its spectral duplicity; yet, this is not Descartes’ Evil Genius (böse Geist), the destitution, the demonic, comes from cogito’s substantializaton, accepts lies, destruction, doesn’t question (Schellingian)

OH.content: if public opinion wasn’t ephemeral, if it could take place, it would enable transparent discussion
OH.linkedContent: if public opinion wasn’t ephemeral, if it could take place, it would enable transparent discussion

OH.content: public opinion > ubiquity of a specter

POOF.content: when Nietzsche spectralizes the enemy, no longer reassurance of an identifiable enemy (of a figure at least): not a new ear of peace, human fraternity, but unprecedented violence
POOF.linkedContent: when Nietzsche spectralizes the enemy, no longer reassurance of an identifiable enemy (of a figure at least): not a new ear of peace, human fraternity, but unprecedented violence

POOF.content: friendship can never elude rhetoric of epitáphios, transfixed celebration of spectrality, at once fervent & caught in petrified cold of its inscription (funeral speech, testamentary fervor of heir)
POOF.linkedContent: friendship can never elude rhetoric of epitáphios, transfixed celebration of spectrality, at once fervent & caught in petrified cold of its inscription (funeral speech, testamentary fervor of heir)

POOF.content: Schmitt’s obsessive use of ‘concrete,’ always haunted by the spectral (gespenstisch), which, for Schmitt, is a synonym of ‘abstract’ or ‘empty’ > his book formed amidst these tensions
POOF.linkedContent: Schmitt’s obsessive use of ‘concrete,’ always haunted by the spectral (gespenstisch), which, for Schmitt, is a synonym of ‘abstract’ or ‘empty’ > his book formed amidst these tensions

POOF.content: Derrida links logic of Schmitt’s decisionism to Nietzsche’s teleiopoetic, quasi-messianic perhaps: its actual/effective unveiling need only be possible for it to occur > thus, decisionism is haunted by law of spectrality
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida links logic of Schmitt’s decisionism to Nietzsche’s teleiopoetic, quasi-messianic perhaps: its actual/effective unveiling need only be possible for it to occur > thus, decisionism is haunted by law of spectrality

POOF.content: Hugo [re: humanist vision], like Marx, would like to swear (jurer) & abjure á la fois, on le voit à la fois accueillir et chasser, convoquer et conjurer le spectre, he would like to ‘let the dead bury the dead’ > Hugo: extinguishing of a people evaporating into fraternity
POOF.linkedContent: Hugo [re: humanist vision], like Marx, would like to swear (jurer) & abjure á la fois, on le voit à la fois accueillir et chasser, convoquer et conjurer le spectre, he would like to ‘let the dead bury the dead’ > Hugo: extinguishing of a people evaporating into fraternity

POOF.content: there are specters on both sides of us (past & future), the phantom friends we lost, the arrival of the Superman > ‘it is necessary to love’ = specters, they are to be loved
POOF.linkedContent: there are specters on both sides of us (past & future), the phantom friends we lost, the arrival of the Superman > ‘it is necessary to love’ = specters, they are to be loved

POOF.content: disjunction of spectral distance marks past/future w/ non-reappropriable alterity [p. 307n cf. Düttmann, “What is Called love in…”]
POOF.linkedContent: disjunction of spectral distance marks past/future w/ non-reappropriable alterity [p. 307n cf. Düttmann, “What is Called love in…”]

POOF.content: Nietzsche: higher still than love of man is love of causes and of specters (Sachen und Gespenstern)
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: higher still than love of man is love of causes and of specters (Sachen und Gespenstern)

POOF.content: the 2 names: 1) very structure of testimonial survival stance, a certain spectrality, name survives a priori beyond presence 2) this general structure is enframed (arraisonné) in certain history, chance of filiation, inherited name, that of renown (again, woman excluded)
POOF.linkedContent: the 2 names: 1) very structure of testimonial survival stance, a certain spectrality, name survives a priori beyond presence 2) this general structure is enframed (arraisonné) in certain history, chance of filiation, inherited name, that of renown (again, woman excluded)

SH.content: anniversary ring—seal > date: spectral return of that which will never return
SH.linkedContent: anniversary ring—seal > date: spectral return of that which will never return

SH.content: conventional forms of dating (charts, coded signs, spatiotemporal plottings, clocks,  calendar) assign, consign, absolute singularity, must mark themselves off from themselves, a fatally equivocal power that enunciates the possibility of recurrence > not absolute recurrence (i.e. of the one time of circumcision/birth) but spectral recurrence of that which never will return
SH.linkedContent: conventional forms of dating (charts, coded signs, spatiotemporal plottings, clocks, calendar) assign, consign, absolute singularity, must mark themselves off from themselves, a fatally equivocal power that enunciates the possibility of recurrence > not absolute recurrence (i.e. of the one time of circumcision/birth) but spectral recurrence of that which never will return

SH.content: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us
SH.linkedContent: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us

SH.content: annulment in the annulation of return belongs to movement of dating
SH.linkedContent: annulment in the annulation of return belongs to movement of dating

SH.content: poetry, literature, art, experience of the mask, an intense familiarity w/ ineluctable originarity of specter = ineluctable loss of origin > spectral errancy of words not an accident
SH.linkedContent: poetry, literature, art, experience of the mask, an intense familiarity w/ ineluctable originarity of specter = ineluctable loss of origin > spectral errancy of words not an accident

FWT.content: Hamlet also machine of repression in politics, spectrality governs problematic of mourning & technics, media, virtual reality > general logic of spectrality
FWT.linkedContent: Hamlet also machine of repression in politics, spectrality governs problematic of mourning & technics, media, virtual reality > general logic of spectrality

FWT.content: literature a recent invention, threatened by death, repeats its birth beginning from its end, from a finitude that is its resource & essential specter
FWT.linkedContent: literature a recent invention, threatened by death, repeats its birth beginning from its end, from a finitude that is its resource & essential specter

FWT.content: agrees/disagrees w/ Foucault’s claim death is less visible > spectral logic invades everything: work of mourning, technē of image; visibility is deferred, perhaps, transformation of visible field > never have things been as “visible” in global space as they are today
FWT.linkedContent: agrees/disagrees w/ Foucault’s claim death is less visible > spectral logic invades everything: work of mourning, technē of image; visibility is deferred, perhaps, transformation of visible field > never have things been as “visible” in global space as they are today

ATIA.content: for Descartes, the specter/ghost “conjured” by judgment is simulacrum of “real man,” spectral man as animal-machine, this animal-machine we’re trying to “flush out”
ATIA.linkedContent: for Descartes, the specter/ghost “conjured” by judgment is simulacrum of “real man,” spectral man as animal-machine, this animal-machine we’re trying to “flush out”

GSP.content: Husserl refuses to believe #s/math fall from heaven, pure Platonic idealism, but also refuses, when subjectifying math, to explain #s via “psychologism”: 1) distinguishes # from concept, psychological artifact 2) math irreducible to psychological temporality 3) designates an intentional dimension of objectivity, which no psychological genesis could institute [Frege would call this possibility a bloodless specter (blutloses Gespenst)?]
GSP.linkedContent: Husserl refuses to believe #s/math fall from heaven, pure Platonic idealism, but also refuses, when subjectifying math, to explain #s via “psychologism”: 1) distinguishes # from concept, psychological artifact 2) math irreducible to psychological temporality 3) designates an intentional dimension of objectivity, which no psychological genesis could institute [Frege would call this possibility a bloodless specter (blutloses Gespenst)?]

O.content: dissemination written on back, tain of mirror, not on its inverted specter
O.linkedContent: dissemination written on back, tain of mirror, not on its inverted specter

WAP.content: “public opinion” demands immediate intelligibility: specter of a readership projected or constituted before appealing to it
WAP.linkedContent: “public opinion” demands immediate intelligibility: specter of a readership projected or constituted before appealing to it

DPi.content: daimon for Greeks: divine & inferior to divinity of God (theos), revenant, soul of dead, fate—kind of election, singular destiny; in Christianity, daimon is bad spirit, demonic, evil genius
DPi.linkedContent: daimon for Greeks: divine & inferior to divinity of God (theos), revenant, soul of dead, fate—kind of election, singular destiny; in Christianity, daimon is bad spirit, demonic, evil genius

DPi.content: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation
DPi.linkedContent: daimon (for Socrates) silent before law: philosophy finds its place in this silence of the daimon at moment of condemnation

DPi.content: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious
DPi.linkedContent: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious

DPi.content: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary
DPi.linkedContent: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary

DPi.content: red (on flag) as specter of the dead
DPi.linkedContent: red (on flag) as specter of the dead

REST.content: the unpairing of the shoes, as soon as they’re no longer going anywhere [Derrida gives a spectrum of possible specterings]
REST.linkedContent: the unpairing of the shoes, as soon as they’re no longer going anywhere [Derrida gives a spectrum of possible specterings]

REST.content: [spectrality of stricture]: il s’est rendu dans/avec/à /( ) ses chaussures ——meanings knot/unknot in lace/snare of syntax (tous les sens se nouent et se dénouent dans le lacet de cette syntax)
REST.linkedContent: [spectrality of stricture]: il s’est rendu dans/avec/à /( ) ses chaussures ——meanings knot/unknot in lace/snare of syntax (tous les sens se nouent et se dénouent dans le lacet de cette syntax)

HLP.content: fabulous, phantasma, return of some specter: apparition of specter, vision of phantom, phenomenon of the revenant
HLP.linkedContent: fabulous, phantasma, return of some specter: apparition of specter, vision of phantom, phenomenon of the revenant

HLP.content: fable & phantasm do not belong to true or false
HLP.linkedContent: fable & phantasm do not belong to true or false

HLP.content: irreducible species of simulacrum, penumbral light of a virtuality, neither being nor nothingness (which no ontology/mimetology could account for, subdue w/ reason)
HLP.linkedContent: irreducible species of simulacrum, penumbral light of a virtuality, neither being nor nothingness (which no ontology/mimetology could account for, subdue w/ reason)

TR.content: that “sooner or later” de Man’s text will answer for him: spectral machine
TR.linkedContent: that “sooner or later” de Man’s text will answer for him: spectral machine

PJP.content: quasi “presence” of [de Man’s] spectral vigilance, gaze, we’re being observed internally by him > does not limit our freedom, sharpens our responsibility
PJP.linkedContent: quasi “presence” of [de Man’s] spectral vigilance, gaze, we’re being observed internally by him > does not limit our freedom, sharpens our responsibility

EL.content: for Scholem, Sprache ist Namen, being of language resides in name, not in substantive but nominal, in power of naming (verbs were once names) > Derrida (via an internal reading) adds: must be a spectral haunting, there is a specter because there’s language, language can haunt because names haunt (neither present/absent) our sentences, language summons (convoque)—category of spectral revenant (not a flower of rhetoric) figures a beyond oppositional ontologic or dialectic of presence/absence
EL.linkedContent: for Scholem, Sprache ist Namen, being of language resides in name, not in substantive but nominal, in power of naming (verbs were once names) > Derrida (via an internal reading) adds: must be a spectral haunting, there is a specter because there’s language, language can haunt because names haunt (neither present/absent) our sentences, language summons (convoque)—category of spectral revenant (not a flower of rhetoric) figures a beyond oppositional ontologic or dialectic of presence/absence

AD.content: spectral “possibility”  of pervertibility [of Levinas’ face-to-face] not liminal pervertibility but impossibility of determining a limit btwn perversion & pervertibility
AD.linkedContent: spectral “possibility” of pervertibility [of Levinas’ face-to-face] not liminal pervertibility but impossibility of determining a limit btwn perversion & pervertibility

AD.content: spectral aura of face, figure of Geist, ghost, urgent before “real” qualities > recognize other w/out waiting: exceeds, deconstructs ontological positions
AD.linkedContent: spectral aura of face, figure of Geist, ghost, urgent before “real” qualities > recognize other w/out waiting: exceeds, deconstructs ontological positions

AD.content: no hospitality w/out chance of spectrality; God uncontaminated by Being: rigorous definition of the Face, le tout autre > as spectral as it is spiritual? gives orders, gives pardon
AD.linkedContent: no hospitality w/out chance of spectrality; God uncontaminated by Being: rigorous definition of the Face, le tout autre > as spectral as it is spiritual? gives orders, gives pardon

CF.content: Benjamin’s police w/out borders—faceless, formless specter of its ghostly apparition extends endlessly
CF.linkedContent: Benjamin’s police w/out borders—faceless, formless specter of its ghostly apparition extends endlessly

SPEC.content: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence

SPEC.content: mastery of PP [grand (-père) spéculateur], mastery in general, Herrschaft distanced from PP only to reappropriate itself: tauto-teleology makes other return in domestic specter
SPEC.linkedContent: mastery of PP [grand (-père) spéculateur], mastery in general, Herrschaft distanced from PP only to reappropriate itself: tauto-teleology makes other return in domestic specter
